diet_plan_name: Paleo Meal Plan (Gluten, Egg, Dairy, Yeast-Free)
notes: This meal plan is designed for a Paleo lifestyle, excluding gluten, eggs, dairy, and yeast. Ensure all processed items like sausages, broths, and coconut yogurt are certified free of gluten and other non-compliant ingredients. Drink plenty of water throughout the day.

breakfast.name: Berry Protein Smoothie
breakfast.recipe: Blend 1 scoop of Paleo-friendly protein powder (e.g., beef or collagen peptides), 1 cup of unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 cup of mixed frozen berries, 1 tablespoon of almond butter, 2 cups of fresh spinach, 1/2 cup of kale, 1/4 cup of cucumber, and 1/4 cup of celery until smooth. Add 1/4 cup of water if needed for desired consistency.

lunch.name: Large Chicken Salad
lunch.recipe: Toss 150g of pre-cooked, shredded chicken breast with 4 cups of mixed salad greens, 1 cup of baby spinach, 1/2 sliced cucumber, 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, 1/4 sliced red onion, 1/2 cup of shredded carrots, 1/2 cup of sliced bell peppers, and 1/2 cup of sliced radishes. For the dressing, whisk together 1.5 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, a pinch of salt, and pepper. Top with 1/2 an avocado, sliced, and garnish with fresh herbs.

dinner.name: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Salmon
dinner.recipe: On a large baking sheet, place a 150g salmon fillet, 3 cups of broccoli florets, 2 cups of cauliflower florets, 1 cup of sliced zucchini, 1 cup of sliced bell peppers, and 1 cup of cherry tomatoes. Drizzle with 1 tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt, pepper, dried oregano, and fresh lemon slices. Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-20 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through. Serve with a side of steamed sweet potato (approx. 150g) and garnish with fresh parsley.

breakfast.name: Coconut Chia Pudding
breakfast.recipe: The night before, combine 3 tbsp of chia seeds, 1 cup of light coconut milk, and 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract in a jar. Shake well and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, top with 1/2 a sliced banana, 1 tbsp of toasted slivered almonds, 1/4 cup of fresh berries, 1/4 cup of shredded coconut, and 1/4 cup of sliced strawberries.

lunch.name: Leftover Lemon Herb Salmon and Veggies
lunch.recipe: Enjoy the leftover salmon, broccoli, cauliflower, zucchini, bell peppers, and cherry tomatoes from Monday's dinner. Serve over 2 cups of fresh mixed greens with 1/2 cup of sliced cucumber and 1/4 cup of shredded carrots. Can be eaten cold or gently reheated.

dinner.name: Turkey Meatballs with Zucchini Noodles
dinner.recipe: Mix 150g of ground turkey with 1 minced garlic clove, 1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley, salt, and pepper. Form into meatballs and brown in a pan with 1 tsp of avocado oil. Add 1 cup of crushed tomatoes (passata) and simmer until cooked. Serve over 3 medium spiralized zucchinis ('zoodles'), 1 cup of spiralized carrots, and 1 cup of spiralized beets, which have been lightly sautéed for 2-3 minutes. Garnish with fresh basil and 1/4 cup of cherry tomatoes.

breakfast.name: Sweet Potato 'Toast' with Avocado
breakfast.recipe: Cut a large sweet potato lengthwise into 1/4-inch thick slices. Toast them in a toaster or toaster oven on high for 2-3 cycles until tender. Top two slices with 1/2 a mashed avocado, a squeeze of lime juice, salt, and chili flakes. Serve with 1 cup of fresh spinach, 1/2 cup of sliced cucumber, and 1/4 cup of cherry tomatoes on the side.

lunch.name: Leftover Turkey Meatballs and Zoodles
lunch.recipe: Reheat and enjoy the leftover meatballs and zoodles from Tuesday's dinner.

dinner.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-fry
dinner.recipe: Slice 150g of sirloin steak thinly. In a wok or large pan, heat 1 tbsp coconut oil over high heat. Stir-fry the beef until browned, then set aside. Add 3 cups of broccoli florets, 1 cup of sliced bell peppers, 1 cup of sliced mushrooms, 1 cup of sliced carrots, 1 cup of sliced zucchini, and 1 cup of bean sprouts to the pan, stir-frying for 4-5 minutes. Return beef to the pan. Add a sauce made from 3 tbsp coconut aminos, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1 tsp grated ginger. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Serve over 2 cups of cauliflower rice and garnish with 1/4 cup of sliced green onions.

breakfast.name: Berry Protein Smoothie
breakfast.recipe: Blend 1 scoop of Paleo-friendly protein powder, 1 cup of unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 cup of mixed frozen berries, 1 tablespoon of almond butter, 2 cups of fresh spinach, 1 cup of kale, 1/2 cup of cucumber, 1/2 cup of celery, and 1/4 cup of fresh mint until smooth. Add 1/4 cup of water if needed for desired consistency.

lunch.name: Leftover Beef and Broccoli Stir-fry
lunch.recipe: Reheat and enjoy the leftovers from Wednesday's dinner.

dinner.name: Chicken and Veggie Skewers
dinner.recipe: Cube 150g of chicken breast. Chop 1 red onion, 2 bell peppers, 2 small zucchinis, 1 cup of mushrooms, 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, and 1 cup of pineapple chunks into large pieces. Marinate the chicken and veggies in a mix of 1 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, and dried oregano for 30 minutes. Thread onto skewers and grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes, turning halfway. Serve with 3 cups of mixed greens, 1 cup of sliced cucumber, and 1/2 cup of shredded carrots.

breakfast.name: Coconut Chia Pudding
breakfast.recipe: The night before, combine 3 tbsp of chia seeds, 1 cup of light coconut milk, and 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract in a jar. Shake well and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, top with 1/2 a sliced banana, 1 tbsp of toasted slivered almonds, 1/4 cup of fresh berries, 1/4 cup of shredded coconut, 1/4 cup of sliced strawberries, and 1/4 cup of sliced kiwi.

lunch.name: Leftover Chicken Skewers
lunch.recipe: Remove chicken and veggies from skewers and serve over a bed of mixed greens. Drizzle with a little olive oil and lemon juice.

dinner.name: Shepherd's Pie with Cauliflower Mash
dinner.recipe: Sauté 2 diced carrots, 2 celery stalks, 1 onion, 1 cup of sliced mushrooms, 1 cup of diced zucchini, and 1 cup of diced bell peppers in 1 tbsp olive oil. Add 150g of ground beef and cook until browned. Stir in 1 tbsp tomato paste and 1/2 cup of beef broth; simmer until thickened. For the topping, steam 1 head of cauliflower until tender, then blend with 1 tbsp of coconut oil, salt, and pepper until smooth. Place the meat filling in an oven-safe dish, top with cauliflower mash, and bake at 190°C (375°F) for 20 minutes until bubbly. Serve with 2 cups of steamed broccoli and 1 cup of sautéed spinach.

breakfast.name: Sausage and Sweet Potato Hash
breakfast.recipe: Crumble and cook 2 paleo-friendly sausage links (check ingredients). In the same pan, sauté 1 cup of diced sweet potato, 1 cup of diced bell peppers, 1 cup of diced zucchini, 1 cup of diced mushrooms, and 1 cup of diced onions until tender. Add the sausage back to the pan and mix to combine. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika. Serve with 2 cups of fresh spinach and 1 cup of sliced tomatoes.

lunch.name: Leftover Shepherd's Pie
lunch.recipe: Reheat and enjoy the leftovers from Friday's dinner.

dinner.name: Steak with Roasted Asparagus
dinner.recipe: Season a 150g sirloin steak with salt and pepper and pan-sear in a hot skillet with 1 tsp of avocado oil for 3-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Let it rest. Toss 2 bunches of asparagus, 2 cups of broccoli florets, 2 cups of cauliflower florets, 1 cup of sliced bell peppers, and 1 cup of cherry tomatoes with 1 tbsp of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast at 200°C (400°F) for 10-12 minutes. Serve steak with roasted vegetables and garnish with fresh herbs.

breakfast.name: Fruit Salad with Coconut Yogurt
breakfast.recipe: Combine 2 cups of mixed chopped fruit (like berries, melon, kiwi, and pineapple), 1 cup of sliced strawberries, 1 cup of sliced mango, 1 cup of sliced papaya, and 1/2 cup of pomegranate seeds. Top with 1/2 cup of unsweetened, dairy-free coconut yogurt, 1/4 cup of shredded coconut, and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Serve with 1 cup of fresh mint leaves.

lunch.name: Leftover Steak Salad
lunch.recipe: Slice the leftover steak from Saturday's dinner and serve it over 3 cups of mixed greens with cherry tomatoes and sliced cucumber. Use a simple dressing of 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar (ensure it is yeast-free).

dinner.name: Simple Roasted Chicken and Root Vegetables
dinner.recipe: On a roasting tray, place a chicken leg and thigh (approx. 180g). Surround it with 3 cups of chopped root vegetables (carrots, parsnips, sweet potatoes), 2 cups of broccoli florets, 2 cups of cauliflower florets, 1 cup of sliced bell peppers, 1 cup of sliced zucchini, and 1 cup of cherry tomatoes. Drizzle everything with 1 tbsp of melted coconut oil and season generously with salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme. Roast at 190°C (375°F) for 45-55 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Serve with 2 cups of fresh mixed greens.
